item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR 7/31/2003 S10451-10452; text as passed Senate: CR 7/31/2003 S10452; text of measure as introduced: CR 7/31/2003 S10296-10297)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR 7/31/2003 S10451-10452; text as passed Senate: CR 7/31/2003 S10452; text of measure as introduced: CR 7/31/2003 S10296-10297)

summary.text: Honors the memory of Dr. William R. Bright (founder of Campus Crusade for Christ International and the Global Pastors Network). Expresses condolences to his wife (Vonette Zachary Bright), their grandchildren, their sons (Zac and Brad), and their wives (Terry and Katherine).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Honors the memory of Dr. William R. Bright (founder of Campus Crusade for Christ International and the Global Pastors Network). Expresses condolences to his wife (Vonette Zachary Bright), their grandchildren, their sons (Zac and Brad), and their wives (Terry and Katherine).

bill.title: A resolution honoring the memory of Dr. William R. ("Bill") Bright and commending his life as an example to succeeding generations.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
